traffic.core

Class TrafficStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • traffic.core.TrafficStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class TrafficStream
extends Observable
implements Serializable
    Class representing the properties and behaviour of traffic streams. Traffic streams are likely to be used under the control of phases in the phase plans of intersections. Each traffic stream is responsible for controlling the behaviour of its corresponding signal faces. A traffic stream may have a detector which it can use to tell if it requires service. An intersection's phase plan may wish to use information about which traffic streams require service in order to determine when to change phases.
    Author:
    (C) Neville Churcher
    See Also:
    Phase, SignalFace, Detector, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • recoverObservers

        public void recoverObservers()
        Prior to serialisation this trafficStream might have been observed by one or more SignalFaces. That association (observer registration) is not preserved after de-serialisation. This method (which should only be called from Intersection.recoverObservers()) is a crude way to restore the original observer registrations.

      • addDetector

        public void addDetector(Detector d)
        Add a detector to the traffic stream and reset it. Detectors would normally be used only in actuated intersection environments. If a detector has been added previously then it will no longer be available subsequently.
        See Also:
        needsService

      • go

        public void go(State toState)
        Perform the appropriate actions when we are instructed to go into a new state by the phase controlling us. Observers (e.g. loggers, SignalFaces) are notified so they can take appropriate action.

      • needsService

        public boolean needsService()
        Report whether or not we need service. The caller should really ensure that we actually have been fitted with a detector.
        Returns:
        false if we don't have a detector, otherwise whatever the detector reports.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Phases use this to reset a stream which previously reported that it needed service. Will reset any associated detectors.

      • state

        public State state()
        Getter for current state
        Returns:
        Current State

      • getname

        public String getname()
        The name (typically a short label) of the stream
        Returns:
        stream name

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Identify the stream in a human readable form suitable for use in log messages etc.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver(Observer o)
        Overrides:
